      • getApplication

        public PbcsApplication getApplication(String applicationName)
                               throws PbcsClientException
        Description copied from interface: PbcsPlanningClient
        Returns an application with the specific name. Note that internally this method just pulls the whole list of applications and just filters for the one you want. It is for convenience purposes.
        Specified by:
        getApplication in interface PbcsPlanningClient
        Parameters:
        applicationName - the name of the application to return, case-sensitive
        Returns:
        an application object for the application
        Throws:
        PbcsClientException - if the application is not found

      • downloadFile

        public File downloadFile(String filename)
                  throws PbcsClientException
        Description copied from interface: InteropClient
        Download a file that has been previously uploaded or otherwise exists from an export. Note that it's possible for a file to show on the application snapshot listing (such as provided by InteropClient.listFiles()) but not be able to download that file. This seems to be a quirk in the REST API such that folders themselves are considered files of type LCM.
        Specified by:
        downloadFile in interface InteropClient
        Parameters:
        filename - the name of the file, such as "export.txt"
        Returns:
        a File object with a handle to the downloaded file
        Throws:
        PbcsClientException - if there is an error retrieving the file (network, file doesn't exist)
